intro: Gossypium nanking f. rubicundum, commonly known as the Chinese cotton or red-flowered cotton, is a botanical variant of the cotton genus native to China. It is characterized by its distinctive red flowers, which contrast with the typical white blooms of other cotton species. The plant produces fluffy, white cotton fibers that are harvested for textile use, though it is less commercially significant than other cotton varieties. It thrives in warm, temperate climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. This cultivar is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique floral coloration and genetic traits.
